Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction into renewable hydrocarbon solar fuels is considered as a promising strategy to simultaneously address the global energy and environmental issues.In this study, a binary g-C 3 N 4 ZnO photocatalytic system was constructed via a one-step facile calcination method and further used as a photocatalyst for CO 2 reduction.It was shown that the as-prepared g-C 3 N 4 ZnO photocatalytic system exhibited enhanced photocatalytic activity for CO 2 reduction by a factor of 2.3 compared

and HCl aqueous solution (0.25 mL, 4 M) that was injected into the reactor via a syringe.A 300 W simulated solar Xe arc lamp (Changzhou Siyu Science Co. Ltd, China) was used as the light source and positioned around 10 cm vertically above the photocatalytic reactor. 1 mL of gas products was taken from the reactor aer 1 h irradiation and used for gas component analysis by using a gas chromatograph (GC-2014C, Shimadzu, Japan) equipped with a ame ionized detector (FID) and a methanizer.The products were

dispersed in the added 10 mL of deionized water by ultrasonication for about 30 min to form a suspension.Aer evaporation of water at 80 C, the catalyst was deposited at the bottom of the reactor to form thin lms.Before irradiation, the reactor was blown with nitrogen for 30 min to remove air and ensure that the reaction system was under anaerobic conditions.CO 2 and H 2 O vapor were in situ produced by the reaction of NaHCO 3 (0.12 g, introduced into the reactor before sealing) and HCl aqueous solution

Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

a conventional three-electrode conguration including a working electrode, counter electrode and reference electrode.The working electrode prepared with the sample has an active area of ca.0.5 cm 2 .A Pt wire and AgAgCl electrode (immersed in saturated KCl solution) were used as the counter electrode and reference electrode, respectively.Two different low power LEDs (3 W, 365 and 420 nm) (Shenzhen LAMPLIC Science Co. Spectrophotometer (Hitachi, Japan).The excitation wavelength was 315 nm, the scanning speed was 1200 nm min A1 and the photomultiplier tube (PMT) voltage was 700 V.The width of both the excitation slit and the emission slit was 2.5 nm. The photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 was performed in a 200 mL homemade Pyrex reactor at ambient temperature and atmospheric pressure.The reactor has two openings that were sealed using a silicone rubber septum.Typically, 100 mg of the sample was dispersed in the added 10 mL

a methanizer.The products were calibrated with a standard gas mixture and determined by the retention time.Nitrogen of high purity was used in the GC-2014C as carrier gas.Blank experiments were carried out in the absence of CO 2 or light irradiation to conrm that CO 2 and light were two indispensable factors for photocatalytic CO 2 reduction reactions.
